p: A total of 319 hospitalized patients with serologically confirmed dengue viral infection were included in this study. Among them, 70% were male and patientsâ€™ mean (SD) age was 33.0 (14.07) years, most of them being young adults (age less than 40 years). 304 (95.3%) patients were confirmed by positive dengue NS1 antigen and 15 (4.7%) patients were confirmed by positive dengue specific IgM antibody tests ( Table 1). It was found that 291 (91.2%) and 28 (8.8%) of patients had primary dengue and secondary dengue respectively. It was noted that the travel history to endemic zone was present in 186 (58.3%) of patients. Most of the patients were admitted during the febrile phase of dengue. Among the 319 patients with confirmed dengue infection, 300 (94%) had non-severe dengue including dengue without warning signs (155, 48.6%) and dengue with warning signs (145, 45.5%). The remaining 19 patients (5.9%) were diagnosed as severe dengue. Among the patients with severe dengue, 13 (68.4%), 13 (68.4%) and 2 (10.5%) had severe plasma leakage, organ involvement, and clinical bleeding respectively. Of the 13 patients, who were presented with severe plasma leakage, 1 (7.7%), 7 (53.8%) and 3 (23%) presented with shock, pleural effusion and ascites respectively. Patients with organ involvement mostly presented with liver involvement (6 (46.2%)) followed by kidney involvement (7 (53.8%)).
